meanings.definition: The act of working as a cowboy.
meanings.sent1: Cowboying involves herding cattle on the ranch.
meanings.sent2: He grew up cowboying on the open range.
meanings.sent3: The city slicker tried his hand at cowboying but ended up in a heap of trouble.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, navigating the stock market is like cowboying through a wild frontier.
meanings.sent5: The image of a lone cowboy cowboying under the vast sky is iconic.

meanings.definition: Engaging in activities typical of a cowboy.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cowboying hat and boots to the rodeo.
meanings.sent2: The town had a cowboying festival with horse riding and lasso throwing.
meanings.sent3: The dog's cowboying attempt to round up the ducks was both hilarious and adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her cowboying spirit shone through as she fearlessly tackled the obstacle course.
meanings.sent5: The children played a game of cowboying, pretending to ride horses and wrangle imaginary cattle.

meanings.definition: To behave in a rough or reckless manner.
meanings.sent1: He was cowboying around on the skateboard, risking falls and scrapes.
meanings.sent2: The teenagers were cowboying through the party, causing chaos wherever they went.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but laugh as her cat started cowboying through the living room, knocking over everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: The storm was cowboying across the landscape, tearing down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver was cowboying down the highway, weaving in and out of traffic dangerously.
